webwork-tex.statement: Find a vector parametrization of the curve \(x = -2 z^2\) in the xz-plane. Use \(t\) as the parameter in your answer. \leavevmode\\\relax \leavevmode\\\relax \(\vec{r}(t) =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{15ex}{\hrulefill}}
webwork-tex.solution:
\par \par {\bf Solution: }\par SOLUTION: \leavevmode\\\relax \leavevmode\\\relax Since the curve is in the \(xz\)- plane, it must be \(y = 0\). Letting \(z = t\) yields \(x = -2t^{2}\). \leavevmode\\\relax Thus a vector parametrization of the curve is \[\vec{r}(t) = \langle -2t^{2}, 0, t \rangle\]
\par
